hint.text:
Example : \(0.005 = 5.0 \times 10^{-3} = 5 \times 10^{-3}\).
Here, the decimal point is shifted three places towards the right. Therefore, the exponent value of \(10\,\) is \(-3\)

solution.text: _{{k * Decimal('0.0001')}}_ can also be written as \( _{k}_ \times 10^{-4} \). Thus the power of 10 is -4

content.text: The power of 10 in the standard form of _{{k * Decimal('0.0001')}}_ is ?
